subject: Re: [junit] Re: Observations from a production use of JUnit4
msgSnippet: ... Can you really interrupt a for(;;)?  I thought the method needed at least a yield point for that to happen... -- Cédric [Non-text portions of this message
messageBody:
On 2/2/06, Kent Beck <kentb@...> wrote:
>
> Ben,
>
> Thank you for your detailed comments. Does the following test express your
> expectations?
>
> static public class InfiniteLoopTest {
> @Test(timeout= 100) public void failure() {
> for(;;);
> }
> }


Can you really interrupt a for(;;)? I thought the method needed at least a
yield point for that to happen...

--
Cédric


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
